page.title: 05E.Horsley S. Farming
page.content: It is interesting that none of the 8 farms covered in this area has a dairy herd. 4 farms have store cattle, one has sheep, pigs & store cattle & one has poultry & store cattle. The main reason for this is that a few years ago in order to re- duce excess milk production, it was Government policy to pay farmers to change from dairy to crops. Cash crops such as roots and grain are grown on 250 of its 300 acres. Apart from hay & straw available from some farms, 3 farms sell to the public from their premises. Openview Farm sells poultry, Grove Farm sells fruit & Tollgate Farm sells a variety of meat, some from their own stock, fish (fresh & frozen, fruit and vegetables, eggs & homemade pate and jams. All these units are situated on the main road.
